title: The Poetry of Thomas Hardy - 1 - Penguin Audiobooks
description:
Ã‚Â 

WeÃ‚Â stood by a pond that winter day,

And the sun was white, as though chidden of God,

And a few leaves lay on the starving sod,

Ã‚Â Ã‚Â Ã¢â‚¬â€They had fallen from an ash, and were gray.

Ã‚Â 

Your eyes on me were as eyes that rove
Ã‚Â 
Over tedious riddles solved years ago;

And some words played between us to and froÃ¢â‚¬â€

Ã‚Â Ã‚Â On which lost the more by our love.

Ã‚Â 

The smile on your mouth was the deadest thing

Alive enough to have strength to die;

And a grin of bitterness swept thereby

Ã‚Â Ã‚Â Like an ominous bird a-wingÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.

Ã‚Â 

Since then, keen lessons that love deceives,

And wrings with wrong, have shaped to me

Your face, and the God-curst sun, and a tree,
Ã‚Â Ã‚Â 
Ã‚Â Ã‚Â And a pond edged with grayish leaves.




...flat and toneless, calm and bitterly felt, its essence sharp and hard bleakness. A masterfully controlled intensity. The only sign of vitality on the face of the woman is a sardonic grin of bitterness.

The Penguin Audiobook of the Selected Poems of Thomas Hardy, excellently read by, amongst others, Jeremy Northam and Derek Jacobi, and interspersed with a literate and interesting biographical commentary. 

  (Kindly seed, and if you can't find a seed for any previous poetry torrent go to the folder 'Current Poetry Torrents' and follow the instructions on the pdf.)
